channel.title: Need Help! Computer won't boot up!
channel.description:
Hi,
I need help from someone because I'm baffled on anyway to fix my computer. My computer was running slow, I had extracted a virus from a key generator but norton had said it had taken care of it, and i decided it was time for a reformat and install of windows. I downloaded windows xp pro sp3, and burned an image file. Even though I burned it as an image, I couldnt boot from it on my pc, so I went back and extracted the image, and burnt those files. Once putting that cd on my pc, I was able to start installation. Once it got to the part of restarting and going to the dos version of the setup, it gives me a prompt to go to windows xp setup, or windows xp. Once it goes to windows xp setup, I just get a flashing dos cursor, and nothing happens. Here's the even worse part, I've found that I can't use my arrow keys in the boot up process. At first I thought it was my keyboard, so I wasted $20 on a new one. This new keyboard has let me use the arrow keys, it just wont move up. I know this because the 5 second timer that comes up before it tries to boot to the xp setup disappears after I press the up arrow, but won't go up. I then decided to burn a copy of windows vista and try this. I got into bios and at first, was not able to use my arrow keys. After shutting off my pc for sometime and retrying, I was able. I set the boot process to my cd drive first and made sure that I was set for usb keyboards in the integrated peripherals section. The boot up process offers to take me to boot from the vista cd, but is just followed by a flashing cursor.
Please help, I'm at loss for what I can do to fix this, and trying to save my self a visit to the geeksquad.

item.title: Need Help! Computer won't boot up!
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

alright thanks a lot guys. Im gonna buy a ps2 keyboard and see if that works if resetting the cmos doesnt work.

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help! Computer won't boot up!

item.title: Need Help! Computer won't boot up!
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

use a ps/2 keyboard.

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help! Computer won't boot up!

item.title: Need Help! Computer won't boot up!
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Are you using a ps/2 keyboard? On your motherboard what cmos setting are the little jumpers on?
Best solution is get a Linux live CD, reformat hard drive and start again.
Dont go to Geeksquad because your using an illegal Windows CD so they wont help you.

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help! Computer won't boot up!

item.title: Need Help! Computer won't boot up!
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Try reseting the cmos… Thats what I did and I got things to boot. You might need to go into bios again to set what to boot to.

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help! Computer won't boot up!
